title: Pregnant Lucy-Jo Hudson sparks rumours she's returning to Hollyoaks as she's seen on set
text:

Lucy-Jo Hudson has been spotted on the set of Hollyoaks, sparking rumours that her character Donna-Marie Quinn could be about to return.

The actress, who is currently pregnant with her second child, played the sex worker from July 2018 until April this year.

She was seen at Lime Pictures studios in Liverpool on Tuesday looking stylish in a polka dot midi-skirt and colourful trainers.

Lucy-Jo, 36, who is expecting her first child with boyfriend Lewis Devine, hid her baby bump under a fluffy cream jumper.

She wore her blonde locks in a ponytail and sported a pair of large black rimmed glasses.

(Image: Mercury Press & Media)

(Image: Channel 4)

The soap star kept a protective hand on her belly as she arrived on set carrying her phone and a cup of coffee.

Lucy-Jo announced she was leaving the Channel 4 soap back in April.

She posted on Instagram : "Goodbye @hollyoaksofficial it has been a real pleasure playing skanky Donna-Marie for the past 12 months.

(Image: Mercury Press & Media)

"Not gonna miss the teeth that's for sure... but Thankyou for making me feel welcome... wonderful cast and crew!!"

She is best known for playing Katie Harris in Coronation Street , a role she had from 2002 until 2005.

Lucy-Jo was married to fellow Corrie star Alan Halsall, who plays Tyrone Dobbs, from 2009 until 2018.

(Image: Mercury Press & Media)

(Image: Instagram)

They share one daughter, six-year-old Sienna.

Lucy-Jo began dating Lewis at the end of last year after they met while starring in Snow White And The Seven Dwarfs in 2017.

Meanwhile, Alan has moved on with stunning new girlfriend Tisha Merry, who appeared in Corrie as Steph Britton.
